group_1.textLeft: ...I'm not usually so tired this early.

group_1.textRight: It figures.
We've got Witch-hunting to do, on top of our@regular school lives.

group_1.textLeft: ...And the two of us are commuting from out of@town, to boot.

group_1.textRight: Weren't you reading a book for the entire train@ride, though?
If you're tired, why not take a nap...?

group_1.textLeft: I have a separate stomach just for reading.@...Separate brain?

group_1.textRight: ...Well, if you say so.

group_1.textLeft: Also, I was up all night writing.

group_1.textRight: [chara:303801:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Wait, you haven't slept at ALL?!

group_1.textLeft: I was testing out the feel of my new quill.

group_1.textRight: Your quill?

group_1.narration: Yes. Technically, it's not a quill, but a metal@dip pen made to look like a quill.
In my pursuit of literature throughout history, I felt the need to@study the environments in which famous authors wrote their works.
As such, I felt it was also necessary to try creating with writing@implements that were as historically accurate as possible.
What did those literary greats think, consider and feel@when they wrote a particular phrase?
If I can perfectly master the use of their pens,@perhaps I could find the answers to those questions...

group_1.textRight: ...So basically, you're in modern lit mode right@now?
Well, I just figured that if you were in an older@literature mode, you wouldn't buy a metal quill.
You'd probably go out and buy a real medieval@quill, actual vellum, the whole shebang.
You've already got a waka inkbrush for the@same sort of reason, right?

group_1.textLeft: Yes. I still use it on a regular basis.
The world of waka poetry is fascinatingly deep@as well...
But I feel like mastering modern literature at@the moment.

group_1.textRight: And yet, your weapons are brushes...?
I suppose your magic probably isn't related to@a writing implement.
Or, say, speed-reading foreign works in their@original languages...
Or writing in an elegant pseudoclassic style@more deftly than anyone else...
I doubt it's one of those sorts of abilities.
Because your interests change so often!
At the very least, I don't think it's anything@specific to one particular genre.
After all, you might be in literary criticism@mode tomorrow, for all I know?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, one would certainly be remiss in discussing...
My literary itinerary without mentioning critical@essays.

group_1.textRight: Ding! Okay, that's enough. We're gonna be late@for school if we don't get going.

group_1.textLeft: What's the matter?@That's a rather serious look on your face.

group_1.textRight: It's just... I was thinking about what@Yakumo-san said yesterday.
About that large magical girl group.
...It seems like mutual assistance is their@basic ethos.
Sharing Grief Seeds with each other, exchanging@information...
The fact that so many girls have joined tells@me that there's a good benefit to doing so.

group_1.textLeft: I wouldn't say I'm eager to join. ...I get rather@anxious around new people, after all.
If possible, I'd ideally like to keep working@with just the three of us.

group_1.textRight: ...Then let's go ahead and do that!
Yeah. Before we join anyone else, let's see how@far we can make it on our own!
But to do that...
We're gonna have to get a lot more experience@and strength under our belts.

group_1.textLeft: ...What do you think of visiting the place@Yakumo-san mentioned?
Trying our hand at Endless Mirrors?

group_1.textRight: Great idea!@Let's make that today's destination!

group_1.textCenter: I feel like, if you want to understand anything,@you have to start by experiencing it.
